alert.note: Alert for Union (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 3:29PM MDT until July 20 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Colfax and Union. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Colfax and Union Counties - This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 360 and 374. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
